title: Disney's Beauty and the Beast
description: Step into the enchanted world of *Disney’s Beauty and the Beast, **to be presented by the Heritage Community Theatre as their Christmas theatrical offering*.  *Disney’s Beauty and the Beast* takes place in a small provincial town in France and begins when a prince is transformed into a hideous beast by an enchantress as punishment for his cruel and selfish ways.  When Maurice, the town’s eccentric inventor, becomes lost in the woods on the way to the fair to show off his latest invention, he seeks shelter in an old castle, only to find its master to be a horrible beast that takes him captive. The inventor’s daughter, an adventurous young woman named Belle, trades herself for her father’s freedom when she finds him in the castle. She soon discovers enchanted objects that serve the beast, and they try to make her new life easier.  In order to become human again the Beast must earn Belle’s love before it’s too late.   Based on the Academy-Award winning animated feature, the stage version includes all of the memorable songs from the animated film plus a few new songs written especially for the Broadway musical.

title: Brian Russo: Yoga Bunny
description:
Join local author, Brian Russo, for a special story time featuring his new picture book, ***Yoga Bunny***.
___
 
___
It's a perfect day for yoga, and Bunny is practicing his poses and wishes his friends would do yoga with him! But Lizard is too tired, Fox is in a rush, and Bird has the hiccups. Will Bunny ever be able to get his friends to slow down and realize that yoga just might be the solution to their problems?

title: Irving Berlin's White Christmas
description:
ZIONS BANK – BROADWAY AT THE ECCLES
___
 presents
___
 Irving Berlin’s White Christmas
___
 December 6th – 11th, 2016
___
 Delta Hall at the George S. and Dolores Doré Eccles Theater
___
 Salt Lake City, Utah

IRVING BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS, the stage adaptation of the beloved  classic film, is coming to the Eccles Theater Salt Lake City this  holiday season for just 8 performances, December 6-11, 2016. Bring your  loved ones for a heart-warming celebration of Americana. ArtTix.org is  the official ticketing source for the Eccles Theater and the Zions Bank  Broadway at the Eccles series.

IRVING BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS tells the story of two showbiz  buddies putting on a show in a picturesque Vermont inn, and finding  their perfect mates in the bargain. Full of dancing, romance, laughter  and some of the greatest songs ever written, including “Count Your  Blessings Instead of Sheep,” “Happy Holiday,” “Sisters,” “Blue Skies,”  and the unforgettable title song, IRVING BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS  promises to be a merry and bright experience for the entire family!
___
 The New York Times exclaims “this cozy trip down memory lane should be  put on your wish list.” And, the New York Daily News hailed IRVING  BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS as “a holiday card come to life.”

IRVING BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS features Music and Lyrics by Irving  Berlin with Book by David Ives and Paul Blake and is based upon the  Paramount Pictures film written for the screen by Norman Krasna, Norman  Panama and Melvin Frank.

*Captioned performance for this show is Saturday, December 10th at  2:00PM. Patrons who are interested in the captioned performance should  select seats located Orchestra Right on the Main floor.

Run time: TBA

Recommended for ages 8 and up. No babes in arms. All patrons must have a ticket regardless of age.

title: 7 Levels of Wealth: From Surviving to Thriving
description:
Got money shrinkage? Do you wish you could generate more money in your life and live with greater freedom, ease and enjoyment?  

___

If you are ready to grow your money, increase your income or expand your business - you won't want to miss out! 

___

Our patterns with money come from our past experience, the ideas and associations the mind has attached to money, and even the feelings we hold about money. 

___

So for example, if when the bills come in, you feel stress and think, 'I don't know if there's enough to pay the bills.' Your mind is still recording this response of stress and worry  in the background  of your mind. 

___

If we repeat the pattern several times - the brain creates a habit that money means stress and worry. 

___

So now if your mind has 'decided' that money = stress and worry - your automatic mind could be repelling the very money you desire. 

___

Everyone's brain is set for a certain level of income, your money is a result of how your brain is wired. 

___

We are aware of our money habits and behaviors.  But we are often unaware of what our automatic mind  or unconscious is holding and repeating. 

___

If your unconscious mind has blocks to money, it doesn't matter how hard you work, it doesn't matter how much you scrimp and save or plan, you'll be limited in the amount of money you can receive and enjoy - because your automatic mind has decided your limits. 

___

Come discover how to break through your own glass ceiling and how to grow your money tree. Learn how the 7 Levels of Wealth can align you to what you desire and allow yourself to receive abundance, prosperity and greater levels of money - and well being. 

___

You'll learn powerful processes to align your unconscious mind and your energy to greater wealth and prosperity. You'll learn how to go from Surviving to Thriving. 

Take the Assessment to Find your UNCONSCIOUS Money Blocks.
___

Learn a Powerful Process to Transform Blocks at the Unconscious Level.
___

Identify how to Generate Greater Income with the Current Opportunities Available. 
___

Learn to tap into Intuition with Your Money Management.
___

Discover the Formula that Allows Your Mind to Embrace Abundance. 
___

You'll learn specific processes that you can apply to identify and transform the blocks, align your unconscious to wealth and prosperity and find greater ease and enjoyment in life.  This gives you the formula to boost your income not only for the moment, but on into the future as well, allowing your mind to grow as your money grows. 

___

You can relax into the flow of money, you can find ease and joy with money and with your life. And with this amazing tool set, you'll know how to grow your mind with your money for each new level of wealth and prosperity. 

___

Holly Stokes, The Brain Trainer, Master Neuro Linguistic Programming Practitioner, Certified Thought Pattern Management Practitioner and Hypnotherapist, has more than 20 years experience in the field of applied psychology.  She has authored two books and several CDs designed to rewire the brain for weight loss, health, happiness and success and loves to empower people with 'brain skills' for life.  She has been quoted by Shape Magazine and Active Times, has appeared on radio shows and TV including ABC's Good 4 Utah.   

___

Course Tuition: $147Register 

Register by Nov. 30 for only $127

Only 99 each when you register for 2 people. 

___

See details and register at: http://thebraintrainerllc.com/classes/mind-mastery-7-levels-of-wealth/

title: Christmas in Color
description:
A favorite holiday attraction is returning to Utah this November for its second season. Christmas in Color will open to the public November 18, 2016 and run through December 31, 2016. The mile-long drive-through light and music display will feature one million led lights synchronized to favorite holiday tunes.

Visitors will enjoy the vibrant displays from the comfort of their own cars as they travel through glowing tunnels and passed fields of twinkling lights. Attendees tune their radios to a local channel upon entering the exhibit to watch the lights dance in coordination to the music.

title: Utah Grizzlies - Dec 10
description: Utah Grizzlies vs Rapid City The Grizzlies are the ECHL affiliate of the Anaheim Ducks and have advanced over 200 players to the NHL since beginning play in Utah\. All home games are played at West Valley City's Maverik Center, "Where Everyone Comes To Have Fun\." Maverik Center also hosted hockey during the 2002 Winter Olympics\. Not only are fans entertained by the Grizzlies, who always put on a show, but mascot Grizzbee is known throughout Utah as one of top entertainers around\. He is also the busiest mascot in the state, appearing at multiple events for non\-profit groups and youth sports every weekend\.

title: Steve Vai
description: Steven Siro "Steve" Vai is an American guitarist, composer, singer,  songwriter and producer. He was voted the 10th "Greatest Guitarist" by  Guitar World magazine, and has sold over 15 million records.

title: Diary of a Worm, a Spider, and a Fly
description:
DIARY OF A WORM, A SPIDER, AND A FLY is a musical adventure that takes a look at the world from a bug's perspective.

Salt Lake Acting Company continues our holiday tradition of welcoming our youngest audiences to the theatre with DIARY OF A WORM, A SPIDER, AND A FLY. Each year in conjunction with our children's play, we invite eight Title-1 elementary schools to see the show at no cost. Their eyes light up and their imaginations ignite as they discover the magic of live theatre. 

Book, Music, and Lyrics by Joan Cushing

Directed and Choreographed by Penelope Caywood
host: Amy Ware, Salt Lake Acting Company

title: Winter Wonderettes
description:
If you love 60’s girl group pop music and you also love Christmas, then you are in for a real treat\.  “The Winter Wonderettes” follows Missy, Suzy, Betty Jean, and Cindy Lou as they sing favorite holiday classics with a new spin, like Santa Clause is Coming to Town, Jingle Bell Rock, and Santa baby\.  Audiences will feel like singing along and dancing in the aisle as the Wonderettes take us back to a more innocent time\.
 
It’s 1968 and the Wonderettes are the entertainment for Harpers Hardware Holiday party\.   When Santa \(aka the boss, Mr\. Harper\) is a no\-show, the ladies find that it’s up to them to make sure the evening is filled with Christmas cheer and everyone has a Merry Christmas\.
 
Directed by Addison Welch and lead by the loveable cast of Wonderette Women: Mollee Steel \(Missy\), Kirsten Jacobsen \(Cindy Lou\), Kenzie Stinger \(Suzy\) and Tatiana Quinn \(Betty Jean\) this production of “The Winter Wonderettes” is sure to be your new holiday favorite\.

title: Ugly Christmas Sweater Charity Dance
description:
Light up the dance floor at DF Dance Studio’s Ugly Christmas Sweater Charity Dance. Sweater contest, holiday music, milk & cookies, silent auction, and great dancing from 8-10pm. 

Try a variety of dance styles throughout the night with a Foxtrot lesson for beginners at 7pm. All proceeds go to Crossroads Urban Center, supporting the impoverished and disabled of Salt Lake City. Admission is $15 minimum.
More details:  http://www.dfdancestudio.com/studio-party.html - 801.466.0490 - DF Dance Studio - 2978 S State St SLC

title: Lachlan Patterson
description:
At an early age, Lachlan Patterson knew that he would  have to use his sense of humor to get him through tough situations. At  the age of 19 he performed his first show at an amateur night in his  hometown of Vancouver, B.C.

___

___

After several years spent learning  the art of stand-up comedy, Patterson started to find his stride and  began touring throughout Canada, landing him at festivals like  Montreal’s Just for Laughs, the Halifax Comedy Festival and the Aspen  Rooftop Comedy Festival.

___

___

His television appearances include “The  Tonight Show with Jay Leno,” Comedy Central’s “Live at Gotham,”  “Tosh.O.,” the FX comedy “Legit” and VH1’s “Sexiest Artists.”  Patterson’s debut album “Jokes to Make Love To” made Rooftop Comedy’s  top 10 albums.

___

Lachlan built his recent fan base week after week by  impressing the judges with his accessible, sarcastic observational  comedy on the recent primetime hit “Last Comic Standing.” He finished  the field of hundreds as the runner up…and fan favorite. Must Be 21+ w  Valid ID to Enter.             

       - 21+ Show -     

             **Live Comedy**             :             Genre:              Rated PG

title: Disney's Beauty and the Beast
description: Step into the enchanted world of *Disney’s Beauty and the Beast, **to be presented by the Heritage Community Theatre as their Christmas theatrical offering*.  *Disney’s Beauty and the Beast* takes place in a small provincial town in France and begins when a prince is transformed into a hideous beast by an enchantress as punishment for his cruel and selfish ways. title: It's A Wonderful Life
description:
If you had the chance to see what your life looked like if you were never born, what would you discover about yourself and the worth you bring to those around you?  The heartwarming tale of one man’s journey to find peace on earth this holiday season will brighten the CenterPoint Theater stage and fill theater\-going family and friends with the Holiday spirit\.
George Bailey has always done what’s right\.  He put his sense of wonder and desire to travel abroad aside when his father fell ill and years later he has a wife, family, and a whole adult life filled with stress and worries\.

After a particularly frustrating day George, in a drunken stupor, is standing by the bridge contemplating the worth of his own life, when suddenly a poor old man falls into the river and George not only finds himself jumping in to save the man, but finds himself on an unbelievable pilgrimage to count his blessing and find a new perspective on the life that he has been blessed with\.

This memorable story will bring the Christmas charm to any old miser’s heart this year, so don’t miss a minute of it at CenterPoint Legacy Theatre\.

Directed by Jansen Davis and lead by two talented and inspiring casts, this production of “It’s A Wonderful Life” brings the spirit of love, forgiveness and divine guidance and helps us to remember the worth of each soul on earth\.

title: Cirque Musica - Salt Lake City
description:
On **December 9** at 7:30 PM and **December 10** at 11 AM and 7:30 PM at Abravanel Hall, Utah Symphony will be joined by the cast of Cirque Musica with guest conductor Bob Bernhardt to perform entertaining acrobatics and dramatic feats of strength and grace to the tune of holiday favorites including classics from “O Holy Night” to “The Polar Express” and “Winter Wonderland.” Tickets start at $31 and can be purchased at www.utahsymphony.org or by calling (801) 355-2787.

The visiting performers of Cirque Musica in this holiday spectacular have been prepared by Choreographer Antoinette Di Pietropolo. The cast of Cirque Musica will include: Ivan Arestov, Carole Demers, Roilan Hernandez, Ruslan Khusinov, Andrei Saladonau, Anatolie Sandu, Cristin Sandu, Svetlana Senchihina, Tatyana Senchihina, Jon Weiss, Nicole Weiss, Ashley Winn and their featured “flying” violinist Veronica Gan.

title: An Evening with Adam Savage
locationName: The George S. & Dolores Dore` Eccles Center for the Performing Arts
description: Adam Savage, perhaps best known as the co-creator and host of the popular television series “Myth Busters” delivers his build-it-your-own ingenuity to the stage on December 10. Savage has built everything from spaceships to buddhas to puppets to rifles to sculptures to toys. He has worked in the special effects industry, both film and commercials as an animator, graphic designer, rigger, scenic painter, carpenter, welder… working with everything from glass and plastics to hydraulics and animatronics. He has delivered a TED talk on the TED stage – and brings that brand of humor and curiosity-inspired-can-do-energy to the stage.

IRVING BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS tells the story of two showbiz  buddies putting on a show in a picturesque Vermont inn, and finding  their perfect mates in the bargain. Full of dancing, romance, laughter  and some of the greatest songs ever written, including “Count Your  Blessings Instead of Sheep,” “Happy Holiday,” “Sisters,” “Blue Skies,”  and the unforgettable title song, IRVING BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS  promises to be a merry and bright experience for the entire family!
___
 The New York Times exclaims “this cozy trip down memory lane should be  put on your wish list.” And, the New York Daily News hailed IRVING  BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS as “a holiday card come to life.”

IRVING BERLIN’S WHITE CHRISTMAS features Music and Lyrics by Irving  Berlin with Book by David Ives and Paul Blake and is based upon the  Paramount Pictures film written for the screen by Norman Krasna, Norman  Panama and Melvin Frank.

*Captioned performance for this show is Saturday, December 10th at  2:00PM. Patrons who are interested in the captioned performance should  select seats located Orchestra Right on the Main floor.

Run time: TBA

Recommended for ages 8 and up. No babes in arms. All patrons must have a ticket regardless of age.

title: Todd Johnson
description:
Todd has been fortunate enough to have shared the stage  with names like Weird Al Yankovik, Tommy Chong and the country band Lone  Star. He has performed at several corporate events with clients such as  Walmart , Coca Cola, Pepsi, & Dollar Rent a Car. Todd has also  generously provided laughs for numerous colleges and benefit shows in  honor of the March of Dimes. Not only has Todd been recognized on a  corporate level, but has made a name for himself in the comedy scene by  performing in several Comedy Competitions on the west coast. For  instance, Todd was named Runner Up in the Big Sky Comedy Competition  just last year. He was a finalist twice in the Rocky Mountain Laugh Off,  took 2nd in the Mile High Comedy Competition, and was a finalist in the  29th Seattle International Comedy Competition. A few years back, Todd  was invited to participate in the 2011 Aspen Comedy Festival and was  then invited to perform at the Laughing Skull Festival.              

       - 18+ Show -     

             **Live Comedy**             :             Genre:              Rated PG-13

description: DJ Feral Cat

title: Lachlan Patterson
description:
At an early age, Lachlan Patterson knew that he would  have to use his sense of humor to get him through tough situations. At  the age of 19 he performed his first show at an amateur night in his  hometown of Vancouver, B.C.

___

___

After several years spent learning  the art of stand-up comedy, Patterson started to find his stride and  began touring throughout Canada, landing him at festivals like  Montreal’s Just for Laughs, the Halifax Comedy Festival and the Aspen  Rooftop Comedy Festival.

___

___

His television appearances include “The  Tonight Show with Jay Leno,” Comedy Central’s “Live at Gotham,”  “Tosh.O.,” the FX comedy “Legit” and VH1’s “Sexiest Artists.”  Patterson’s debut album “Jokes to Make Love To” made Rooftop Comedy’s  top 10 albums.

___

Lachlan built his recent fan base week after week by  impressing the judges with his accessible, sarcastic observational  comedy on the recent primetime hit “Last Comic Standing.” He finished  the field of hundreds as the runner up…and fan favorite. Must Be 21+ w  Valid ID to Enter.             

       - 21+ Show -     

             **Live Comedy**             :             Genre:              Rated PG

title: Pasties and Presents Burlesque Show
description: The Pasties and Presents Burlesque Show is a burlesque version of The Nutcracker that is the creation of The Candy Cabinet Cabaret troupe director Racheal Williams aka Miss Brawling Beauty. The performance incorporates burlesque, boylesque, puppeteers, hoopers, extreme circus, acrobats, aerialists and belly dancers. Don't miss this amazing show that will awaken your sensual appetite during this holiday season.

title: Oliver!
description:
Pioneer Theatre Company presents *Oliver!,* the award-winning musical by Lionel Bart inspired by the orphan's tale, *Oliver Twist,* written by Charles Dickens. *Oliver!* runs December 2 to December 17, 2016
.

 

Charles Dickens' tale of the plucky orphan has been turned into a rousing musical featuring one of the most memorable Broadway scores ever written, including "Food, Glorious Food," "Where Is Love?," "Consider Yourself," "You've Got To Pick A Pocket or Two," "Who Will Buy," and more. 
___

*Oliver! *was the first musical adaptation of Dickens' to become a stage hit. *Oliver! *debuted on Broadway in 1963, winning the Tony Award for Best Musical Score and has enjoyed several revivals over the years. It was turned into a movie in 1968, winning the Academy Award for Best Picture.

___
The professional Equity cast of 14 is joined by local cast members, including 13 child actors. 

**
___
BILL NOLTE **plays Fagin, the career criminal who lures in homeless orphans and educates them in the fine art of picking pockets. Nolte is a veteran who has been seen on Broadway in *The Producers, Amour, Jane Eyre, 1776* (revival),* King David, A Christmas Carol, Me and My Girl, Joseph...Dreamcoat *(revival),* The Secret Garden, La Cage Aux Folles *(revival) and* Cats.* **
___
**

___

PTC alums **HOWARD KAYE** and **NATALIE HILL** play the brutal Bill Sykes and his soft-hearted girlfriend Nancy. Kaye returns to PTC after *It Happened One Christmas, The Music Man *and* Peter and the Starcatcher. *He toured with the Broadway production of* Mamma Mia! *and also appeared on Broadway in* Miss Saigon. *Hill was last seen at PTC in *Sweet Charity, In the Heights *and in* Miss Saigon. *A Utah native, she received her degree in music from NYU, and stayed in New York City, appearing on Broadway in Frank Wildhorn's *Wonderland, **Bye Bye Birdie *and* Grease. *

___
**MAXWELL RIMINGTON** and C**HRISTIAN LABERTEW **play the title role of Oliver Twist, the lonely orphan boy and The Artful Dodger, the most clever of Fagin's pickpockets. Rimington makes his PTC debut, but has recent local credits in *Mary Poppins* and *Seussical*. Labertew, a senior at Park City High School, returns to PTC after *A Christmas Carol-The Musical.*

___

Broadway veterans **KEVIN LIGON** and **LINDA GRIFFIN** both debut at PTC playing Mr. Bumble and Mrs. Corney, whom he later marries.

___

Ligon has appeared in the Broadway productions of *On The Twentieth Century, Bullets Over Broadway, The Phantom Of The Opera, Sister Act, Finian's Rainbow, Young Frankenstein, The Producers, Kiss Me Kate, 1776 *and* The Secret Garden. *In addition to a career in film and TV, Ligon will be in the highly-anticipated Broadway revival this spring of *Hello, Dolly!* starring Bette Midler. Griffin was an original cast member of Broadway shows *Something Rotten! *and* The Drowsy Chaperone* and can be heard on both Grammy nominated cast albums. She was featured in the Broadway tours of *Wicked, A Chorus Line, 42nd Street* and *Disney's Beauty and the Beast.*

 

**JAMES MICHAEL REILLY** and **CAROL SCHUBERG** play Mr. and Mrs. Sowerberry, the often cruel couple who take Oliver in their home to employ him in their business. Reilly has been seen at regional theatres across the U.S., including Geva, Denver Center, and the Alabama Shakespeare Festival. This is his PTC debut. Schuberg returns to PTC after appearing in S*weet Charity, Fiddler on the Roof *and* How to Succeed in Business.... *She has also performed on Broadway in *Meet Me in St. Louis.*

___

Oliver's kind and wealthy grandfather, Mr. Brownlow, and the role of Mrs. Bedwin are played by local Utah Equity actors **RICHARD SCOTT **and **COLLEEN BAUM,** respectively.

**
___
**

**JESSICA BLAIR, KYLE BRAND, LENNY DANIEL, STEPHANIE MALONEY, MYLES MC HALE **and** ADAM PELLEGRINE **comprise the remaining Equity cast members. 

___

**ALEXIS BAIGUE, MICHELLE BLAKE, BAILEY CUMMINGS, TAMARI DUNBAR, LUKE SIDNEY JOHNSON, MANDY MC DONELL, JOHN PETERSON** and **TORI SICKLICK** complete the ensemble. 

___

Local young actor **ABIGAIL HIGBEE** plays the role of Bet, Nancy's young friend. **NATALIA BINGHAM, AFTON GRACE HIGBEE, AVA HOEKSTRA, MILO MOZAFFARI, JT O'REILLY, MASON SHANKS, BRANDON SMITH, DIXON TRUMBO, MASON TRUMBO **and** BRANDON WELKER** comprise the rest of young people in the cast.
___

* *

Pioneer Theatre Company Artistic Director **KAREN AZENBERG** directs and choreographs this production. Azenberg is in her fifth year as Artistic Director and directed the regional premiere of Sting's *The Last Ship* to open the 2016-2017 season. Last season, she directed *Fiddler on the Roof, The Rocky Horror Show* and *It Happened One Christmas*. Originally from New York, Azenberg's work there includes *Lyrics and Lyricists *(92nd St. Y), *Blocks* (a collaboration with Jonathan Larson), *Prom Queens Unchained*, and choreography for Richard Greenberg's *The Dazzle* (Roundabout). 

___

**TOM GRIFFIN** returns to PTC as the guest Musical Director after recent productions It* Happened One Christmas, Peter & The Starcatcher, Elf-The Musical* and* A Christmas Carol: The Musical. *He also musically directed the West Coast and Los Angeles premieres of *The Last Five Years, Sweet Charity, Sweeney Todd *and* The Music Man; *the West Coast premiere of *Spitfire Grill; Annie, West Side Story, The Scarlet Pimpernel *and* Bye Bye Birdie.*

___

Scenic design is by **GEORGE MAXWELL**. He has been the resident scenic designer at Pioneer Theatre Company for over 25 years and has designed over 90 productions for the company. Last season he designed *Fiddler on the Roof *and* It Happened One Christmas. *

 

Resident Costume Designer **K.L. ALBERTS **marks his 29th year at PTC, and has designed a wide range of shows, including *Of Mice and Men, *both* Les Misèrables, The Producers, Elf-The Musical*and* The Music Man. *Alberts has also costumed casts for the Utah Shakespeare Festival.

 

Lighting design is by **KIRK BOOKMAN**. Bookman's New York credits include *Charles Busch's The Tribute Artist, *and* The Divine Sister*. He most recently designed for *The Glass Menagerie *and*Fiddler on the Roof.**
___
***

 

Hair and makeup design is by PTC resident designer **AMANDA FRENCH**; sound design is by PTC resident designer **JOSHUA C. HIGHT**. **CHRISTOPHER DU VAL **is Resident Fight Choreographer. **SARAH SHIPPPBOTHAM** is the Dialect Coach.

___

* * *

**
___
PUBLICITY PHOTO SHOOT:** There will be an off-site Publicity Photo Shoot on F**riday, November 18, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.** at *This is the Place* State Monument. Please call 801-581-6270 to RSVP. 

**
___
**

**MEDIA PHOTOS AVAILABLE TO DOWNLOAD**: High-resolution color photos of this production will be available for media use on the PTC website beginning Monday, November 21, 2016 after 3:00 p.m.Go directly to http://www.pioneertheatre.org/press-room/media-photos/ to view the photos.

___

**TV CAMERA FILMING**: Filming a short segment of the production during Preview or Opening Night for press use can be arranged. Call 801-581-6270.

___

**INTERVIEWS**: Interviews with the cast and artistic staff are available. Call 801-581-6270.

 

**WHO**:            

Pioneer Theatre Company

 

**WHAT**:

*Oliver!*

Music, Book and Lyrics By Lionel Bart

 

**WHEN**:

Decmber 2 - December 17, 2016 

 

**TIMES**:

**New Curtain Times 2016-2017 Season**

Mondays - Thursdays, 7:00 p.m.

Fridays and Saturdays, 7:30 p.m.

Saturday matinees, 2:00 p.m.

 

**WHERE**:

Simmons Pioneer Memorial Theatre

300 South 1400 East, Salt Lake City

 

**PRICES**:

$40 - $62 in advance, and $5 more when purchased on the day of the show

Kids in grades K-12 are half-price on Mondays and Tuesdays

 

**MORE INFO**:   

Box Office: 801-581-6961

Open 10:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m., Mon - Fri

www.pioneertheatre.org

   

 

 

**ADULT CAST**:

title: Trees of Diversity
description: Since 2005 the Cultural Center has ended the year with a magical, holiday tree exhibit that overflows form the art gallery and throughout the entire facility. Come see how different ethnic groups, arts organizations, and local businesses find inspiration and decorate their holiday trees.

title: The Night Before Christmas
description:
Salt Lake Ballet Theater
___
 presents
___
 The Night Before Christmas
___
 December 9th & 10th, 2016
___
 Jeanné Wagner Theatre
___
 Rose Wagner Performing Arts Center
___
 Salt Lake City, Utah

On sale: 11/2/2016 at 10am.

On Christmas Eve a young girl named Alexandria is given a wonderful  Christmas Party by her parents. The party is complete with entertainment  and gifts for all the children.

After the party Alexandria falls asleep and finds herself immersed in  a splendid dream. Her dream begins with a visit from the beautiful  Christmas Fairy who takes her to Santa’s workshop where she sees all the  splendid toys and candies that are being prepared for Christmas day.  Santa sends her to visit the lovely Snow Queen and her icicle maidens.  She then visits the Kingdom of the Sweets where she visits Clara and her  Nutcracker Prince.

Alexandria then visits the Palace of the Christmas Fairy, and is most  surprised when her journey takes her to visit Mother Goose in Storybook  Land. She is delighted by her favorite Storybook characters and hopes  her dream will never end. As she begins to awaken she hears a stirring  in the Parlor. Santa and his elves have arrived but so has the Horrible  Hateful Harry and his Grinches. They attempt to kidnap Santa. See what  happens… Can the children save Santa?

Run time: 2 hours including 15 minute intermission.

Recommended for ages 8 and up. No babes-in-arms. All patrons require a ticket regardless of age.

title: Ben Steele
description:
Modern West Fine Art will display a solo

___

exhibition from painter Ben Steele, for their November show. Ben Steele considers himself to be on the

___

outside of the Art World looking in. His new body of work “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly” combines a

___

juxtaposition of fresh pop imagery with classical themes. His refined oil paintings transform well-known

___

treasures into contemporary concept-driven works of art. The opening reception will be during the November

___

Gallery Stroll on Friday, November 18 from 6:30 -8 p.m. and will be on display through January 14, 2017.

___

About Modern West Fine Art:

___

Modern West Fine Art is a gallery created by Diane Stewart to support contemporary artists whose works

___

offer imaginative interpretations of the west. The artists represented offer a variety of points of view and

___

representations of western lifestyle. The gallery aspires to support the local community through informative

___

events, allowing the community to gather in the space to express themselves and experience western art

___

with a contemporary influence.  

___

About Ben Steele:

___

Ben Steele was born in Kennewick, Washington and relocated to Utah in his teen, graduating from the

___

University of Utah in 2002 with a BFA in Painting and Drawing. He continued his education at the Helper

___

Workshops, an art education and apprenticeship program in Helper, Utah, under the instruction of artists

___

David Dornan and Paul Davis. His work can be found in numerous collections and he shows extensively

___

across the nation. Ben currently lives in Helper with his family.

title: The Silly Holiday Bazaar

title: DAC Holiday Market
description:
The Downtown Artist Collective Holiday Market December opening event. Our resident DAC artists and invited local artists will be selling original art, prints, ceramics, and small gift items.

___

Come experience work from our DAC artists Alexis Hansen, Chris Bodily, Chris Madsen, Desarae Lee, Emily Bagley Hayford, Heather Romney, Jamie Kyle, Jason Jones , Malinda Fisher, Prajit Ravindran, Sarah May, Scott Filipiak, Kayla Varnell, Miroslava Vomela, and Jenny Hambleton.

___

You will also find art and gifts from Andrew Whicker, Anthony Siciliano, Ben Sang, Chloe Monson, Innerspacism, Jenn Olson, Jerry Hardesty, Kristin Curry, Mark Jones, Nite & Day, Rob Stinogle, Stephanie Swift,  and Stephanie Hillman.

___

Market will run through the 24th of December.

___

Gallery hours:

Thursday-Saturday 11am-7pm

Sunday 12pm-5pm

title: Diary of a Worm, a Spider, and a Fly
description:
DIARY OF A WORM, A SPIDER, AND A FLY is a musical adventure that takes a look at the world from a bug's perspective.

Salt Lake Acting Company continues our holiday tradition of welcoming our youngest audiences to the theatre with DIARY OF A WORM, A SPIDER, AND A FLY. Each year in conjunction with our children's play, we invite eight Title-1 elementary schools to see the show at no cost. Their eyes light up and their imaginations ignite as they discover the magic of live theatre. 

Book, Music, and Lyrics by Joan Cushing

Directed and Choreographed by Penelope Caywood
host: Amy Ware, Salt Lake Acting Company

title: Comedy Cares
description:
For the last eight years, Comedian Guy Seidel has teamed  up with Mick & Allen of the Freakshow on KBER101 to bring the  Comedy Cares Fundraiser.
___
Every year at Christmas time, Guy gathers  raffle and auction items from various friends, family, businesses and  artists, then in mid-December he takes all of that free stuff and puts  it on a stage at Wiseguys Comedy Club, you attend the show and buy  raffle tickets, as many as you want for a dollar each, several hilarious  comedians perform and everyone has a good time.
___

___
After the  comedians get done telling their jokes, they raffle off some items and  we auction off some items. All money raised is then given to Mick and  Allen at KBER 101, they, then split the money up and give it to local  families in need, who have written in to M&A asking for help. You  actually get to hear the money going to work, every penny goes to local  families.
___

___
Must Be 21+ w Valid ID to Enter. 
___

       - 21+ Show -     

             **Live Comedy**             :             Genre:              Rated R (Mild)

title: The Nutcracker
description:
Mountain West Ballet, Sandy city’s community-based, non-profit ballet company, announces its annual performance of the holiday treasure The Nutcracker.  

___

Follow Clara and her prince as they dance their way through the land of sweets. Marvel at the mice and the waltzing flowers. Enjoy this beautiful ballet with the whole family.

___

This special holiday production will run for 12 performances from December 9 - 20, 2016 at the theater at Eastmont (10100 S 1300 E) in Sandy. Evening performances begin at 7:30 p.m., and matinee performances on Saturday will begin at 12 noon and 4:00 p.m.  

___

Ticket prices range from $10 to $15. To purchase tickets or for more

___

information, please visit www.MountainWestBallet.org or call 801.572.6222.

___

About Mountain West Ballet:

___

Mountain West Ballet is a non-profit organization that was organized in

___

1.  It is committed to preserving, advancing and sharing the beauty of

___

ballet. MWB provides performing opportunities for aspiring dancers to

___

work in a professional, nurturing atmosphere and benefits the community

___

by providing affordable quality productions for entertainment and

___

educational purposes.  

___

Mountain West Ballet wishes to recognize and thank Sandy City, Salt

___

Lake County the Zoo, Arts and Parks Program and George S. and Dolores

___

Doré Eccles Foundation for their continued support.

Reilly has been seen at regional theatres across the U.S., including Geva, Denver Center, and the Alabama Shakespeare Festival. This is his PTC debut. Schuberg returns to PTC after appearing in S*weet Charity, Fiddler on the Roof *and* How to Succeed in Business.... *She has also performed on Broadway in *Meet Me in St. Louis.*

___

Oliver's kind and wealthy grandfather, Mr. Brownlow, and the role of Mrs. Bedwin are played by local Utah Equity actors **RICHARD SCOTT **and **COLLEEN BAUM,** respectively.

**
___
**

**JESSICA BLAIR, KYLE BRAND, LENNY DANIEL, STEPHANIE MALONEY, MYLES MC HALE **and** ADAM PELLEGRINE **comprise the remaining Equity cast members. 

___

**ALEXIS BAIGUE, MICHELLE BLAKE, BAILEY CUMMINGS, TAMARI DUNBAR, LUKE SIDNEY JOHNSON, MANDY MC DONELL, JOHN PETERSON** and **TORI SICKLICK** complete the ensemble. 

___

Local young actor **ABIGAIL HIGBEE** plays the role of Bet, Nancy's young friend. **NATALIA BINGHAM, AFTON GRACE HIGBEE, AVA HOEKSTRA, MILO MOZAFFARI, JT O'REILLY, MASON SHANKS, BRANDON SMITH, DIXON TRUMBO, MASON TRUMBO **and** BRANDON WELKER** comprise the rest of young people in the cast.
___

* *

Pioneer Theatre Company Artistic Director **KAREN AZENBERG** directs and choreographs this production. Azenberg is in her fifth year as Artistic Director and directed the regional premiere of Sting's *The Last Ship* to open the 2016-2017 season. Last season, she directed *Fiddler on the Roof, The Rocky Horror Show* and *It Happened One Christmas*. Originally from New York, Azenberg's work there includes *Lyrics and Lyricists *(92nd St. Y), *Blocks* (a collaboration with Jonathan Larson), *Prom Queens Unchained*, and choreography for Richard Greenberg's *The Dazzle* (Roundabout). 

___

**TOM GRIFFIN** returns to PTC as the guest Musical Director after recent productions It* Happened One Christmas, Peter & The Starcatcher, Elf-The Musical* and* A Christmas Carol: The Musical. *He also musically directed the West Coast and Los Angeles premieres of *The Last Five Years, Sweet Charity, Sweeney Todd *and* The Music Man; *the West Coast premiere of *Spitfire Grill; Annie, West Side Story, The Scarlet Pimpernel *and* Bye Bye Birdie.*

___

Scenic design is by **GEORGE MAXWELL**. He has been the resident scenic designer at Pioneer Theatre Company for over 25 years and has designed over 90 productions for the company. Last season he designed *Fiddler on the Roof *and* It Happened One Christmas. *

 

Resident Costume Designer **K.L. ALBERTS **marks his 29th year at PTC, and has designed a wide range of shows, including *Of Mice and Men, *both* Les Misèrables, The Producers, Elf-The Musical*and* The Music Man. *Alberts has also costumed casts for the Utah Shakespeare Festival.

 

Lighting design is by **KIRK BOOKMAN**. Bookman's New York credits include *Charles Busch's The Tribute Artist, *and* The Divine Sister*. He most recently designed for *The Glass Menagerie *and*Fiddler on the Roof.**
___
***

 

Hair and makeup design is by PTC resident designer **AMANDA FRENCH**; sound design is by PTC resident designer **JOSHUA C. HIGHT**. **CHRISTOPHER DU VAL **is Resident Fight Choreographer. **SARAH SHIPPPBOTHAM** is the Dialect Coach.

___

* * *

**
___
PUBLICITY PHOTO SHOOT:** There will be an off-site Publicity Photo Shoot on F**riday, November 18, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.** at *This is the Place* State Monument. Please call 801-581-6270 to RSVP. 

**
___
**

**MEDIA PHOTOS AVAILABLE TO DOWNLOAD**: High-resolution color photos of this production will be available for media use on the PTC website beginning Monday, November 21, 2016 after 3:00 p.m.Go directly to http://www.pioneertheatre.org/press-room/media-photos/ to view the photos.

___

**TV CAMERA FILMING**: Filming a short segment of the production during Preview or Opening Night for press use can be arranged. Call 801-581-6270.

___

**INTERVIEWS**: Interviews with the cast and artistic staff are available. Call 801-581-6270.

title: Trees of Diversity
description: Since 2005 the Cultural Center has ended the year with a magical, holiday tree exhibit that overflows form the art gallery and throughout the entire facility. Come see how different ethnic groups, arts organizations, and local businesses find inspiration and decorate their holiday trees.

title: Ben Steele
description:
Modern West Fine Art will display a solo

___

exhibition from painter Ben Steele, for their November show. Ben Steele considers himself to be on the

___

outside of the Art World looking in. His new body of work “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly” combines a

___

juxtaposition of fresh pop imagery with classical themes. His refined oil paintings transform well-known

___

treasures into contemporary concept-driven works of art. The opening reception will be during the November

___

Gallery Stroll on Friday, November 18 from 6:30 -8 p.m. and will be on display through January 14, 2017.

___

About Modern West Fine Art:

___

Modern West Fine Art is a gallery created by Diane Stewart to support contemporary artists whose works

___

offer imaginative interpretations of the west. The artists represented offer a variety of points of view and

___

representations of western lifestyle. The gallery aspires to support the local community through informative

___

events, allowing the community to gather in the space to express themselves and experience western art

___

with a contemporary influence.  

___

About Ben Steele:

___

Ben Steele was born in Kennewick, Washington and relocated to Utah in his teen, graduating from the

___

University of Utah in 2002 with a BFA in Painting and Drawing. He continued his education at the Helper

___

Workshops, an art education and apprenticeship program in Helper, Utah, under the instruction of artists

___

David Dornan and Paul Davis. His work can be found in numerous collections and he shows extensively

___

across the nation. Ben currently lives in Helper with his family.

title: Spinal Checkup Special
description:
Practice Opening Special
Spinal checkup includes consultation, full exam, x\-rays if needed, and report of findings with Dr\. Epperson 
$400 value for just $40\!

title: Pictures with Santa
description:
This year Santa photographs will be provided by Cherry Hill Photo. Photo packages start at $13.00 with additional offers from Shutterfly. Shoppers will have the opportunity to own their Santa photographs and share them with friends and family. Please see the Santa photo staff for additional details. All children visiting Santa Claus will receive a treat.

title: Interfaith Christmas Concert
description: Join in voice and song at Bountiful's Interfaith Christmas Concert, a benefit for CCS Refugee Relocation Program\. Hosted at Bountiful Community Church, with participation from The LDS community, St\. Olaf, Episcopal Church of the Resurrection, Bountiful First Baptist, Good Shepherd Fellowship, Bahai' Faith, and more\. All are welcome to join the Interfaith Choir, with one rehearsal directly before the concert \(5:30pm\) with Director Michael Huff\.

title: Vigil to End Gun Violence
description:
This December marks the 4th anniversary of the Sandy Hook School shooting. **Since that horrendous day, more than 120,000 Americans have been killed in gun violence**, including the victims of the Orlando shooting earlier this year, San Bernadino and Charleston shootings in 2015 and the Washington Navy Yard shooting in 2013. Many more have been wounded and are living with the aftermath of gun violence.

On** Sunday, December 11 from 7-8 pm at All Saints Episcopal Church** we will honor victims and survivors of gun violence. The service will be a Taize Meditation.

**Join us as we shine a light on this tragic toll. Members of all faith communities are welcome to this interfaith service.**
host: Nancy Halden, Gun Violence Prevention Center of Utah

title: Bert's Family Christmas Trees & Wagon Rides
description:
Our family is selling Christmas trees & Wagon Rides\! 

$75 includes a horse drawn wagon ride for your entire family out to our lot to select the perfect Christmas tree, any size\! Our trees are beautiful, fresh cut grown wild in Montana\. We will trim it up & deliver it to your vehicle, of course, by horse drawn wagon\.

Looking for just a wagon ride? $3 per person around our family farm\. Enjoy our livestock including our resident bison, watusi cattle, donkey, chickens & more\! Have a large group? No problem\. We take reservations\!

Open Monday thru Friday, 4 pm to 9 pm\. Saturday 9 am to 9 pm\. Closed Sundays\. 

Visit our Facebook page at @BertsFamilyChristmasTrees for more details\. We would love to see you\!

title: Springville Art Commission Concert: Utah Valley Handbell Choir
description:
Experience joyous holiday music provided by the Utah Valley Handbell Choir. 
___

___
The Utah Valley Handbell Choir was formed in 1993 by director Karen Eskew-Wyllie. The members volunteer their time to share their love of bells.
___

___
The choir has 61 bells cast in bronze or aluminum, each tuned to a single note. When rung together, they produce melodies full of rich overtones. Sacred as well as popular songs are part of their repetoire.

title: Christmas in Color
description:
A favorite holiday attraction is returning to Utah this November for its second season. Christmas in Color will open to the public November 18, 2016 and run through December 31, 2016. The mile-long drive-through light and music display will feature one million led lights synchronized to favorite holiday tunes.

Visitors will enjoy the vibrant displays from the comfort of their own cars as they travel through glowing tunnels and passed fields of twinkling lights. Attendees tune their radios to a local channel upon entering the exhibit to watch the lights dance in coordination to the music.

title: A Very Merry Bar J Christmas
Andrew Hunt: Desolation Flats
description:
Join Hillerman award winner,  Andrew Hunt, for a reading and signing of his latest mystery novel, ***Desolation Flats***.

As war clouds loom overseas, auto racers from around the world gather at the Bonneville Salt Flats east of Salt Lake City, intent on breaking the land speed record. When Nigel Underhill, a wealthy English motorist, is found dead and his brother Clive disappears, Art Oveson of the Salt Lake City Missing Persons' Bureau is called to investigate. The Underhill family has hired a former Scotland Yard detective to assist in the search, and he and Oveson begin to follow a trail that leads from the Utah desert to the stately homes of London. As the two detectives draw closer to their suspect, Art finds that the murderer has set his sights on a target much closer to home than he had thought possible

title: Winter Wonderettes
description:
If you love 60’s girl group pop music and you also love Christmas, then you are in for a real treat\.  “The Winter Wonderettes” follows Missy, Suzy, Betty Jean, and Cindy Lou as they sing favorite holiday classics with a new spin, like Santa Clause is Coming to Town, Jingle Bell Rock, and Santa baby\.  Audiences will feel like singing along and dancing in the aisle as the Wonderettes take us back to a more innocent time\.
 
It’s 1968 and the Wonderettes are the entertainment for Harpers Hardware Holiday party\.   When Santa \(aka the boss, Mr\. Harper\) is a no\-show, the ladies find that it’s up to them to make sure the evening is filled with Christmas cheer and everyone has a Merry Christmas\.
 
Directed by Addison Welch and lead by the loveable cast of Wonderette Women: Mollee Steel \(Missy\), Kirsten Jacobsen \(Cindy Lou\), Kenzie Stinger \(Suzy\) and Tatiana Quinn \(Betty Jean\) this production of “The Winter Wonderettes” is sure to be your new holiday favorite\.

title: A Christmas Carol Ballet
description:
Tooele Valley Academy of Dance
___
 presents
___
 A Christmas Carol Ballet
___
 Monday, December 12th, 2016 at 7:00pm
___
 Jeanné Wagner Theatre
___
 Rose Wagner Performing Arts Center
___
 Salt Lake City, Utah

On sale: 11/1/2016 at 10am.

A beautiful retelling of Charles Dickens’ “A Christmas Carol,” this  production mixes classical music and classical dancing with a large  measure of Christmas Spirit.

Run time: 120 minutes including 20 minute intermission.

Recommended for ages 8 and up. No babes-in-arms. All patrons require a ticket regardless of age.

title: Bonnie Harris Christmas Jazz Concert
description: Local singer and numerous award winner Bonnie Harris will sing Christmas classics. The annual concert is a staple in the community, now celebrating its 20th year. Take a break from the Christmas rush and relax with Bonnie’s soothing alto voice. Joining Bonnie this year is a full ensemble orchestra with the rhythm and back beat to get you out of your seat!  This family friendly concert is the perfect way to remember the good times of Christmases past, and rekindle the glow of Christmas present.

title: Disney's Beauty and the Beast
description: Step into the enchanted world of *Disney’s Beauty and the Beast, **to be presented by the Heritage Community Theatre as their Christmas theatrical offering*.  *Disney’s Beauty and the Beast* takes place in a small provincial town in France and begins when a prince is transformed into a hideous beast by an enchantress as punishment for his cruel and selfish ways.  When Maurice, the town’s eccentric inventor, becomes lost in the woods on the way to the fair to show off his latest invention, he seeks shelter in an old castle, only to find its master to be a horrible beast that takes him captive. The inventor’s daughter, an adventurous young woman named Belle, trades herself for her father’s freedom when she finds him in the castle. She soon discovers enchanted objects that serve the beast, and they try to make her new life easier.  In order to become human again the Beast must earn Belle’s love before it’s too late.   Based on the Academy-Award winning animated feature, the stage version includes all of the memorable songs from the animated film plus a few new songs written especially for the Broadway musical.

title: GENTRI: Finding Christmas
description:
Pakt House Entertainment Group
___
 presents
___
 **GENTRI**: Finding Christmas
___
 *with Special Guest* **Lexi Walker**
___
 *Feauturing the ***American Heritage Lyceum Philharmonic**
___
 Monday, December 12th, 2016 at 7:30pm
___
 Abravanel Hall
___
 Salt Lake City, Utah

On sale: 9/1/2016 at 10am.

With the upcoming release of GENTRI’s new Christmas album, Finding  Christmas, experience it live at Abravanel Hall, Monday, December 12,  2016 with special guest Lexi Walker featuring the American Heritage  Lyceum Philharmonic.

No professional recording equipment allowed.

$150 VIP INCLUDES: Front Row Seat with Private GENTRI Meet &  Greet, Photo Op and 1 Signed copy of the new album, Finding Christmas.

Run time: 130 minutes.

Family event. All patrons require a ticket regardless of age.

title: It's A Wonderful Life
description:
If you had the chance to see what your life looked like if you were never born, what would you discover about yourself and the worth you bring to those around you?  The heartwarming tale of one man’s journey to find peace on earth this holiday season will brighten the CenterPoint Theater stage and fill theater\-going family and friends with the Holiday spirit\.
George Bailey has always done what’s right\.  He put his sense of wonder and desire to travel abroad aside when his father fell ill and years later he has a wife, family, and a whole adult life filled with stress and worries\.

After a particularly frustrating day George, in a drunken stupor, is standing by the bridge contemplating the worth of his own life, when suddenly a poor old man falls into the river and George not only finds himself jumping in to save the man, but finds himself on an unbelievable pilgrimage to count his blessing and find a new perspective on the life that he has been blessed with\.

This memorable story will bring the Christmas charm to any old miser’s heart this year, so don’t miss a minute of it at CenterPoint Legacy Theatre\.

Directed by Jansen Davis and lead by two talented and inspiring casts, this production of “It’s A Wonderful Life” brings the spirit of love, forgiveness and divine guidance and helps us to remember the worth of each soul on earth\.

title: Disney's Beauty & the Beast
description:
Step into the enchanted world of *Disney’s Beauty and the Beast, **to be presented by the Heritage Community Theatre as their Christmas theatrical offering*.  *Disney’s Beauty and the Beast* takes place in a small provincial town in France and begins when a prince is transformed into a hideous beast by an enchantress as punishment for his cruel and selfish ways.  When Maurice, the town’s eccentric inventor, becomes lost in the woods on the way to the fair to show off his latest invention, he seeks shelter in an old castle, only to find its master to be a horrible beast that takes him captive. The inventor’s daughter, an adventurous young woman named Belle, trades herself for her father’s freedom when she finds him in the castle. She soon discovers enchanted objects that serve the beast, and they try to make her new life easier.  In order to become human again the Beast must earn Belle’s love before it’s too late.   Based on the Academy-Award winning animated feature, the stage version includes all of the memorable songs from the animated film plus a few new songs written especially for the Broadway musical.

___

Disney’s Beauty and the Beast will open Friday, November 25, and will play Mondays, Fridays, and Saturdays through December 17 at 7:30 p.m., with matinees at 2:00 p.m. on December 3, 10, and 17.  Closing performance will be the matinee on December 17. 

For an enchanted evening, come “Be Our Guest” at the Heritage Theatre.

title: The Nutcracker
description:
Mountain West Ballet, Sandy city’s community-based, non-profit ballet company, announces its annual performance of the holiday treasure The Nutcracker.  

___

Follow Clara and her prince as they dance their way through the land of sweets. Marvel at the mice and the waltzing flowers. Enjoy this beautiful ballet with the whole family.

___

This special holiday production will run for 12 performances from December 9 - 20, 2016 at the theater at Eastmont (10100 S 1300 E) in Sandy. Evening performances begin at 7:30 p.m., and matinee performances on Saturday will begin at 12 noon and 4:00 p.m.  

___

Ticket prices range from $10 to $15. To purchase tickets or for more

___

information, please visit www.MountainWestBallet.org or call 801.572.6222.

___

About Mountain West Ballet:

___

Mountain West Ballet is a non-profit organization that was organized in

___

1.  It is committed to preserving, advancing and sharing the beauty of

___

ballet. MWB provides performing opportunities for aspiring dancers to

___

work in a professional, nurturing atmosphere and benefits the community

___

by providing affordable quality productions for entertainment and

___

educational purposes.  

___

Mountain West Ballet wishes to recognize and thank Sandy City, Salt

___

Lake County the Zoo, Arts and Parks Program and George S. and Dolores

___

Doré Eccles Foundation for their continued support.

title: The Wood Brothers
description: Dubbed "Masters of soulful folk" by Paste, The Wood Brothers released  their debut studio album, 'Ways Not To Lose,' on Blue Note in 2006.  You'd be forgiven at the time for expecting it to be something of a side  project. Chris Wood already had legions of devoted fans for his  incomparable work as one-third of Medeski Martin & Wood, while his  brother Oliver toured with Tinsley Ellis before releasing a half-dozen  albums with his band King Johnson. Almost a decade later and with  drummer Jano Rix added as a permanent third member, it's become quite  clear that The Wood Brothers is indeed the main act.

title: Oliver!
description:
Pioneer Theatre Company presents *Oliver!,* the award-winning musical by Lionel Bart inspired by the orphan's tale, *Oliver Twist,* written by Charles Dickens. *Oliver!* runs December 2 to December 17, 2016
.

 

Charles Dickens' tale of the plucky orphan has been turned into a rousing musical featuring one of the most memorable Broadway scores ever written, including "Food, Glorious Food," "Where Is Love?," "Consider Yourself," "You've Got To Pick A Pocket or Two," "Who Will Buy," and more. 
___

*Oliver! *was the first musical adaptation of Dickens' to become a stage hit. *Oliver! *debuted on Broadway in 1963, winning the Tony Award for Best Musical Score and has enjoyed several revivals over the years. It was turned into a movie in 1968, winning the Academy Award for Best Picture.

___
The professional Equity cast of 14 is joined by local cast members, including 13 child actors. 

**
___
BILL NOLTE **plays Fagin, the career criminal who lures in homeless orphans and educates them in the fine art of picking pockets. Nolte is a veteran who has been seen on Broadway in *The Producers, Amour, Jane Eyre, 1776* (revival),* King David, A Christmas Carol, Me and My Girl, Joseph...Dreamcoat *(revival),* The Secret Garden, La Cage Aux Folles *(revival) and* Cats.* **
___
**

___

PTC alums **HOWARD KAYE** and **NATALIE HILL** play the brutal Bill Sykes and his soft-hearted girlfriend Nancy. Kaye returns to PTC after *It Happened One Christmas, The Music Man *and* Peter and the Starcatcher. *He toured with the Broadway production of* Mamma Mia! *and also appeared on Broadway in* Miss Saigon. *Hill was last seen at PTC in *Sweet Charity, In the Heights *and in* Miss Saigon. *A Utah native, she received her degree in music from NYU, and stayed in New York City, appearing on Broadway in Frank Wildhorn's *Wonderland, **Bye Bye Birdie *and* Grease. *

___
**MAXWELL RIMINGTON** and C**HRISTIAN LABERTEW **play the title role of Oliver Twist, the lonely orphan boy and The Artful Dodger, the most clever of Fagin's pickpockets. Rimington makes his PTC debut, but has recent local credits in *Mary Poppins* and *Seussical*. Labertew, a senior at Park City High School, returns to PTC after *A Christmas Carol-The Musical.*

___

Broadway veterans **KEVIN LIGON** and **LINDA GRIFFIN** both debut at PTC playing Mr. Bumble and Mrs. Corney, whom he later marries.

___

Ligon has appeared in the Broadway productions of *On The Twentieth Century, Bullets Over Broadway, The Phantom Of The Opera, Sister Act, Finian's Rainbow, Young Frankenstein, The Producers, Kiss Me Kate, 1776 *and* The Secret Garden. *In addition to a career in film and TV, Ligon will be in the highly-anticipated Broadway revival this spring of *Hello, Dolly!* starring Bette Midler. Griffin was an original cast member of Broadway shows *Something Rotten! *and* The Drowsy Chaperone* and can be heard on both Grammy nominated cast albums. She was featured in the Broadway tours of *Wicked, A Chorus Line, 42nd Street* and *Disney's Beauty and the Beast.*

 

**JAMES MICHAEL REILLY** and **CAROL SCHUBERG** play Mr. and Mrs. Sowerberry, the often cruel couple who take Oliver in their home to employ him in their business. Reilly has been seen at regional theatres across the U.S., including Geva, Denver Center, and the Alabama Shakespeare Festival. This is his PTC debut. Schuberg returns to PTC after appearing in S*weet Charity, Fiddler on the Roof *and* How to Succeed in Business.... *She has also performed on Broadway in *Meet Me in St. Louis.*

___

Oliver's kind and wealthy grandfather, Mr. Brownlow, and the role of Mrs. Bedwin are played by local Utah Equity actors **RICHARD SCOTT **and **COLLEEN BAUM,** respectively.

**
___
**

**JESSICA BLAIR, KYLE BRAND, LENNY DANIEL, STEPHANIE MALONEY, MYLES MC HALE **and** ADAM PELLEGRINE **comprise the remaining Equity cast members. 

___

**ALEXIS BAIGUE, MICHELLE BLAKE, BAILEY CUMMINGS, TAMARI DUNBAR, LUKE SIDNEY JOHNSON, MANDY MC DONELL, JOHN PETERSON** and **TORI SICKLICK** complete the ensemble. 

___

Local young actor **ABIGAIL HIGBEE** plays the role of Bet, Nancy's young friend. **NATALIA BINGHAM, AFTON GRACE HIGBEE, AVA HOEKSTRA, MILO MOZAFFARI, JT O'REILLY, MASON SHANKS, BRANDON SMITH, DIXON TRUMBO, MASON TRUMBO **and** BRANDON WELKER** comprise the rest of young people in the cast.
___

* *

Pioneer Theatre Company Artistic Director **KAREN AZENBERG** directs and choreographs this production. Azenberg is in her fifth year as Artistic Director and directed the regional premiere of Sting's *The Last Ship* to open the 2016-2017 season. Last season, she directed *Fiddler on the Roof, The Rocky Horror Show* and *It Happened One Christmas*. Originally from New York, Azenberg's work there includes *Lyrics and Lyricists *(92nd St. Y), *Blocks* (a collaboration with Jonathan Larson), *Prom Queens Unchained*, and choreography for Richard Greenberg's *The Dazzle* (Roundabout). 

___

**TOM GRIFFIN** returns to PTC as the guest Musical Director after recent productions It* Happened One Christmas, Peter & The Starcatcher, Elf-The Musical* and* A Christmas Carol: The Musical. *He also musically directed the West Coast and Los Angeles premieres of *The Last Five Years, Sweet Charity, Sweeney Todd *and* The Music Man; *the West Coast premiere of *Spitfire Grill; Annie, West Side Story, The Scarlet Pimpernel *and* Bye Bye Birdie.*

___

Scenic design is by **GEORGE MAXWELL**. He has been the resident scenic designer at Pioneer Theatre Company for over 25 years and has designed over 90 productions for the company. Last season he designed *Fiddler on the Roof *and* It Happened One Christmas. *

 

Resident Costume Designer **K.L. ALBERTS **marks his 29th year at PTC, and has designed a wide range of shows, including *Of Mice and Men, *both* Les Misèrables, The Producers, Elf-The Musical*and* The Music Man. *Alberts has also costumed casts for the Utah Shakespeare Festival.

 

Lighting design is by **KIRK BOOKMAN**. Bookman's New York credits include *Charles Busch's The Tribute Artist, *and* The Divine Sister*. He most recently designed for *The Glass Menagerie *and*Fiddler on the Roof.**
___
***

 

Hair and makeup design is by PTC resident designer **AMANDA FRENCH**; sound design is by PTC resident designer **JOSHUA C. HIGHT**. **CHRISTOPHER DU VAL **is Resident Fight Choreographer. **SARAH SHIPPPBOTHAM** is the Dialect Coach.

title: Ben Steele
description:
Modern West Fine Art will display a solo

___

exhibition from painter Ben Steele, for their November show. Ben Steele considers himself to be on the

___

outside of the Art World looking in. His new body of work “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly” combines a

___

juxtaposition of fresh pop imagery with classical themes. His refined oil paintings transform well-known

___

treasures into contemporary concept-driven works of art. The opening reception will be during the November

___

Gallery Stroll on Friday, November 18 from 6:30 -8 p.m. and will be on display through January 14, 2017.

___

About Modern West Fine Art:

___

Modern West Fine Art is a gallery created by Diane Stewart to support contemporary artists whose works

___

offer imaginative interpretations of the west. The artists represented offer a variety of points of view and

___

representations of western lifestyle. The gallery aspires to support the local community through informative

___

events, allowing the community to gather in the space to express themselves and experience western art

___

with a contemporary influence.  

___

About Ben Steele:

___

Ben Steele was born in Kennewick, Washington and relocated to Utah in his teen, graduating from the

___

University of Utah in 2002 with a BFA in Painting and Drawing. He continued his education at the Helper

___

Workshops, an art education and apprenticeship program in Helper, Utah, under the instruction of artists

___

David Dornan and Paul Davis. His work can be found in numerous collections and he shows extensively

___

across the nation. Ben currently lives in Helper with his family.

title: Bert's Family Christmas Trees & Wagon Rides
description:
Our family is selling Christmas trees & Wagon Rides\! 

$75 includes a horse drawn wagon ride for your entire family out to our lot to select the perfect Christmas tree, any size\! Our trees are beautiful, fresh cut grown wild in Montana\. We will trim it up & deliver it to your vehicle, of course, by horse drawn wagon\.

Looking for just a wagon ride? $3 per person around our family farm\. Enjoy our livestock including our resident bison, watusi cattle, donkey, chickens & more\! Have a large group? No problem\. We take reservations\!

Open Monday thru Friday, 4 pm to 9 pm\. Saturday 9 am to 9 pm\. Closed Sundays\. 

Visit our Facebook page at @BertsFamilyChristmasTrees for more details\. We would love to see you\!

title: Christmas in Color
description:
A favorite holiday attraction is returning to Utah this November for its second season. Christmas in Color will open to the public November 18, 2016 and run through December 31, 2016. The mile-long drive-through light and music display will feature one million led lights synchronized to favorite holiday tunes.

Visitors will enjoy the vibrant displays from the comfort of their own cars as they travel through glowing tunnels and passed fields of twinkling lights. Attendees tune their radios to a local channel upon entering the exhibit to watch the lights dance in coordination to the music.

description: Star Wars movie night at Good Grammar!  Star Wars trivia, top contender wins a prize!

title: Cyber Security Workshop
description:
Are You Ready for the Inevitable? 
The probability of your business failing is very high if you don’t have good cyber security in place\. However, cyber\-security does not need to be expensive nor  me consuming\. 
Come learn from an expert what you can do in your business to greatly reduce the risk of a cyber breach\. 
You will learn 
  What needs to be protected in your busi\- ness 
  How to e ec vely protect your business from cyber\-crime using free and very low cost programs and apps 
  How to prepare and implement a security policy 
  What legal risks you face in the event of a cyber\-security breach 
  What you should do if you get hacked

title: It's A Wonderful Life
description:
If you had the chance to see what your life looked like if you were never born, what would you discover about yourself and the worth you bring to those around you?  The heartwarming tale of one man’s journey to find peace on earth this holiday season will brighten the CenterPoint Theater stage and fill theater\-going family and friends with the Holiday spirit\.
George Bailey has always done what’s right\.  He put his sense of wonder and desire to travel abroad aside when his father fell ill and years later he has a wife, family, and a whole adult life filled with stress and worries\.

After a particularly frustrating day George, in a drunken stupor, is standing by the bridge contemplating the worth of his own life, when suddenly a poor old man falls into the river and George not only finds himself jumping in to save the man, but finds himself on an unbelievable pilgrimage to count his blessing and find a new perspective on the life that he has been blessed with\.

This memorable story will bring the Christmas charm to any old miser’s heart this year, so don’t miss a minute of it at CenterPoint Legacy Theatre\.

Directed by Jansen Davis and lead by two talented and inspiring casts, this production of “It’s A Wonderful Life” brings the spirit of love, forgiveness and divine guidance and helps us to remember the worth of each soul on earth\.

title: The Nutcracker
description:
Mountain West Ballet, Sandy city’s community-based, non-profit ballet company, announces its annual performance of the holiday treasure The Nutcracker.  

___

Follow Clara and her prince as they dance their way through the land of sweets. Marvel at the mice and the waltzing flowers. Enjoy this beautiful ballet with the whole family.

___

This special holiday production will run for 12 performances from December 9 - 20, 2016 at the theater at Eastmont (10100 S 1300 E) in Sandy. Evening performances begin at 7:30 p.m., and matinee performances on Saturday will begin at 12 noon and 4:00 p.m.  

___

Ticket prices range from $10 to $15. To purchase tickets or for more

___

information, please visit www.MountainWestBallet.org or call 801.572.6222.

___

About Mountain West Ballet:

___

Mountain West Ballet is a non-profit organization that was organized in

___

1.  It is committed to preserving, advancing and sharing the beauty of

___

ballet. MWB provides performing opportunities for aspiring dancers to

___

work in a professional, nurturing atmosphere and benefits the community

___

by providing affordable quality productions for entertainment and

___

educational purposes.  

___

Mountain West Ballet wishes to recognize and thank Sandy City, Salt

___

Lake County the Zoo, Arts and Parks Program and George S. and Dolores

___

Doré Eccles Foundation for their continued support.

title: Oliver!
description:
Pioneer Theatre Company presents *Oliver!,* the award-winning musical by Lionel Bart inspired by the orphan's tale, *Oliver Twist,* written by Charles Dickens. *Oliver!* runs December 2 to December 17, 2016
.

 

Charles Dickens' tale of the plucky orphan has been turned into a rousing musical featuring one of the most memorable Broadway scores ever written, including "Food, Glorious Food," "Where Is Love?," "Consider Yourself," "You've Got To Pick A Pocket or Two," "Who Will Buy," and more. 
___

*Oliver! *was the first musical adaptation of Dickens' to become a stage hit. *Oliver! *debuted on Broadway in 1963, winning the Tony Award for Best Musical Score and has enjoyed several revivals over the years. It was turned into a movie in 1968, winning the Academy Award for Best Picture.

___
The professional Equity cast of 14 is joined by local cast members, including 13 child actors. 

**
___
BILL NOLTE **plays Fagin, the career criminal who lures in homeless orphans and educates them in the fine art of picking pockets. Nolte is a veteran who has been seen on Broadway in *The Producers, Amour, Jane Eyre, 1776* (revival),* King David, A Christmas Carol, Me and My Girl, Joseph...Dreamcoat *(revival),* The Secret Garden, La Cage Aux Folles *(revival) and* Cats.* **
___
**

___

PTC alums **HOWARD KAYE** and **NATALIE HILL** play the brutal Bill Sykes and his soft-hearted girlfriend Nancy. Kaye returns to PTC after *It Happened One Christmas, The Music Man *and* Peter and the Starcatcher. *He toured with the Broadway production of* Mamma Mia! *and also appeared on Broadway in* Miss Saigon. *Hill was last seen at PTC in *Sweet Charity, In the Heights *and in* Miss Saigon. *A Utah native, she received her degree in music from NYU, and stayed in New York City, appearing on Broadway in Frank Wildhorn's *Wonderland, **Bye Bye Birdie *and* Grease. *

___
**MAXWELL RIMINGTON** and C**HRISTIAN LABERTEW **play the title role of Oliver Twist, the lonely orphan boy and The Artful Dodger, the most clever of Fagin's pickpockets. Rimington makes his PTC debut, but has recent local credits in *Mary Poppins* and *Seussical*. Labertew, a senior at Park City High School, returns to PTC after *A Christmas Carol-The Musical.*

___

Broadway veterans **KEVIN LIGON** and **LINDA GRIFFIN** both debut at PTC playing Mr. Bumble and Mrs. Corney, whom he later marries.

___

Ligon has appeared in the Broadway productions of *On The Twentieth Century, Bullets Over Broadway, The Phantom Of The Opera, Sister Act, Finian's Rainbow, Young Frankenstein, The Producers, Kiss Me Kate, 1776 *and* The Secret Garden. *In addition to a career in film and TV, Ligon will be in the highly-anticipated Broadway revival this spring of *Hello, Dolly!* starring Bette Midler. Griffin was an original cast member of Broadway shows *Something Rotten! *and* The Drowsy Chaperone* and can be heard on both Grammy nominated cast albums. She was featured in the Broadway tours of *Wicked, A Chorus Line, 42nd Street* and *Disney's Beauty and the Beast.*

 

**JAMES MICHAEL REILLY** and **CAROL SCHUBERG** play Mr. and Mrs. Sowerberry, the often cruel couple who take Oliver in their home to employ him in their business. Reilly has been seen at regional theatres across the U.S., including Geva, Denver Center, and the Alabama Shakespeare Festival. This is his PTC debut. Schuberg returns to PTC after appearing in S*weet Charity, Fiddler on the Roof *and* How to Succeed in Business.... *She has also performed on Broadway in *Meet Me in St. Louis.*

___

Oliver's kind and wealthy grandfather, Mr. Brownlow, and the role of Mrs. Bedwin are played by local Utah Equity actors **RICHARD SCOTT **and **COLLEEN BAUM,** respectively.

**
___
**

**JESSICA BLAIR, KYLE BRAND, LENNY DANIEL, STEPHANIE MALONEY, MYLES MC HALE **and** ADAM PELLEGRINE **comprise the remaining Equity cast members. 

___

**ALEXIS BAIGUE, MICHELLE BLAKE, BAILEY CUMMINGS, TAMARI DUNBAR, LUKE SIDNEY JOHNSON, MANDY MC DONELL, JOHN PETERSON** and **TORI SICKLICK** complete the ensemble. 

___

Local young actor **ABIGAIL HIGBEE** plays the role of Bet, Nancy's young friend. **NATALIA BINGHAM, AFTON GRACE HIGBEE, AVA HOEKSTRA, MILO MOZAFFARI, JT O'REILLY, MASON SHANKS, BRANDON SMITH, DIXON TRUMBO, MASON TRUMBO **and** BRANDON WELKER** comprise the rest of young people in the cast.
___

* *

Pioneer Theatre Company Artistic Director **KAREN AZENBERG** directs and choreographs this production. Azenberg is in her fifth year as Artistic Director and directed the regional premiere of Sting's *The Last Ship* to open the 2016-2017 season. Last season, she directed *Fiddler on the Roof, The Rocky Horror Show* and *It Happened One Christmas*. Originally from New York, Azenberg's work there includes *Lyrics and Lyricists *(92nd St. Y), *Blocks* (a collaboration with Jonathan Larson), *Prom Queens Unchained*, and choreography for Richard Greenberg's *The Dazzle* (Roundabout). 

___

**TOM GRIFFIN** returns to PTC as the guest Musical Director after recent productions It* Happened One Christmas, Peter & The Starcatcher, Elf-The Musical* and* A Christmas Carol: The Musical. *He also musically directed the West Coast and Los Angeles premieres of *The Last Five Years, Sweet Charity, Sweeney Todd *and* The Music Man; *the West Coast premiere of *Spitfire Grill; Annie, West Side Story, The Scarlet Pimpernel *and* Bye Bye Birdie.*

___

Scenic design is by **GEORGE MAXWELL**. He has been the resident scenic designer at Pioneer Theatre Company for over 25 years and has designed over 90 productions for the company. Last season he designed *Fiddler on the Roof *and* It Happened One Christmas. *

 

Resident Costume Designer **K.L. ALBERTS **marks his 29th year at PTC, and has designed a wide range of shows, including *Of Mice and Men, *both* Les Misèrables, The Producers, Elf-The Musical*and* The Music Man. *Alberts has also costumed casts for the Utah Shakespeare Festival.

 

Lighting design is by **KIRK BOOKMAN**. Bookman's New York credits include *Charles Busch's The Tribute Artist, *and* The Divine Sister*. He most recently designed for *The Glass Menagerie *and*Fiddler on the Roof.**
___
***

 

Hair and makeup design is by PTC resident designer **AMANDA FRENCH**; sound design is by PTC resident designer **JOSHUA C. HIGHT**. **CHRISTOPHER DU VAL **is Resident Fight Choreographer. **SARAH SHIPPPBOTHAM** is the Dialect Coach.

___

* * *

**
___
PUBLICITY PHOTO SHOOT:** There will be an off-site Publicity Photo Shoot on F**riday, November 18, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.** at *This is the Place* State Monument. Please call 801-581-6270 to RSVP. 

**
___
**

**MEDIA PHOTOS AVAILABLE TO DOWNLOAD**: High-resolution color photos of this production will be available for media use on the PTC website beginning Monday, November 21, 2016 after 3:00 p.m.Go directly to http://www.pioneertheatre.org/press-room/media-photos/ to view the photos.

___

**TV CAMERA FILMING**: Filming a short segment of the production during Preview or Opening Night for press use can be arranged. Call 801-581-6270.

___

**INTERVIEWS**: Interviews with the cast and artistic staff are available. Call 801-581-6270.

description:
Join us for our weekly Humpday social at the Huddle in Cottonwood Heights!  Yes, this is a sports bar - but  it doesn't feel like it when our crowd is there...
___

___
 2 weeks ago was our biggest and best crowd yet with over 100 in attendance! 
___

___
 PLEASE SHARE THIS PUBLIC EVENT FOR ME AND INVITE YOUR FRIENDS  - I SPEND TOO MUCH TIME MARKETING...

title: Open Mic Night
description:
Every Wednesday night is our weekly Wiseguys Open Mic  night. This is the night to see the 20 to 25 of the best local, amateur  and professional comedians in Utah perform. Not only do we feature great  local comedians, but we also have our share of touring comedians who  happen to stop by to perform. So, you never know who you may see on  Wednesday Wiseguys Open Mic night, but you can always count on an  awesome and interesting time! Wiseguys Open Mic is also your chance to  try your hand at stand-up comedy. Every comedian that is making a living  as a professional started out at open mic and it's every Wednesday at  Wiseguys at the Gateway in downtown Salt Lake City. If you think you're  funny and you want to give it a shot then come on down! Maybe you're the  next Seinfeld...you never know until you get up there and give it a  try! Bring your friends. We encourage you to invite lots of people. The  more friends you bring the funnier you will seem! We'll see you there!   Must Be 21+ with Valid ID to Enter.             

       - 21+ Show -

title: It's A Wonderful Life
description:
If you had the chance to see what your life looked like if you were never born, what would you discover about yourself and the worth you bring to those around you?  The heartwarming tale of one man’s journey to find peace on earth this holiday season will brighten the CenterPoint Theater stage and fill theater\-going family and friends with the Holiday spirit\.
George Bailey has always done what’s right\.  He put his sense of wonder and desire to travel abroad aside when his father fell ill and years later he has a wife, family, and a whole adult life filled with stress and worries\.

After a particularly frustrating day George, in a drunken stupor, is standing by the bridge contemplating the worth of his own life, when suddenly a poor old man falls into the river and George not only finds himself jumping in to save the man, but finds himself on an unbelievable pilgrimage to count his blessing and find a new perspective on the life that he has been blessed with\.

This memorable story will bring the Christmas charm to any old miser’s heart this year, so don’t miss a minute of it at CenterPoint Legacy Theatre\.

Directed by Jansen Davis and lead by two talented and inspiring casts, this production of “It’s A Wonderful Life” brings the spirit of love, forgiveness and divine guidance and helps us to remember the worth of each soul on earth\.
